title: Ethereum Price is Primed For a Rally And Only 1 Thing is Holding it Back - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum price is correcting gains after failing to clear the $1,920 resistance level. The price is trading above $1,880 and a crucial bullish trend line, but could decline if it breaks the $1,870 support. A move above $1,920 and $1,930 might send Ether towards $2,000, but a failure to do so could lead to a decline towards $1,870. Technical indicators such as MACD and RSI are bearish.

title: 'Bitcoin Jesus' says Ethereum is the front-runner for global crypto adoption - Cointelegraph
summary: Bitcoin investor and advocate Roger Ver believes Ethereum is the front-runner for global crypto adoption, despite scaling issues. Ver praises EVM-compatible blockchains and layer-2 solutions, but criticizes the recent Ledger debate, calling it disappointing. He also addresses a lawsuit from a trading unit of Genesis, claiming he has sufficient funds to pay an outstanding sum but argues the company is no longer solvent. Finally, he addresses claims of defaulting on a debt, denying them without directly mentioning the company.

title: 5 Years After the $500K Ethereum Wager Between Joe Lubin and Jimmy Song, Who Won? - CoinDesk
summary: In 2017, Joe Lubin and Jimmy Song made a $500,000 bet on the future of decentralized applications (dapps) on the Ethereum blockchain. Five years later, the outcome of the bet is still unknown, as neither party has declared a winner. According to Artemis Chief Operating Officer Jimmy Zheng, all five dapps (WETH, OpenSea, Circle, Tether, and Ether) qualify as dapps as they are built on the Ethereum blockchain and allow for interactions with other contracts/addresses. The definition of an application is seen as a construct, with the smart contracts being the atomic unit, and other contracts/addresses interacting with them.

title: Degens Can’t Stop Sending Millions in Ethereum to Random Wallets on Twitter - Decrypt
summary: Degens are sending millions of dollars in Ethereum to random Twitter users who promise exclusive token "presales" or even nothing at all. The trend has led to people handing over their hard-earned Ethereum to wallets that have received over $1 million worth of crypto, including 626 Ethereum worth over $1.1 million to a wallet called "yougetnothing.eth." Despite the lack of utility many meme coins offer, the market capitalization of some coins like BEN has grown to $46 million, yet the token has fallen more than 47% over the past week. The influencer behind "yougetnothing.eth" described it as a performance art and a case study in mass psychological experiment. People are also sending obscure meme tokens to the address, and the wallet has received a variety of other tokens, including PepeCoin and Tether.

title: Economist Alex Krüger Flips Bullish on Bitcoin and Ethereum, Says Markets Gearing Up for Bull Run - The Daily Hodl
summary: Economist Alex Krüger is bullish on Bitcoin and Ethereum, predicting a strong finish to the year. He believes the Federal Reserve's interest rate hikes are nearing an end, and the markets will rally as early as August. Krüger is taking long positions on both BTC and ETH, expecting big moves to the upside. However, he warns that if Bitcoin retests $26,000, it may show further weakness.

title: Can Ethereum Beat Bitcoin? Crypto Expert Reveals Surprising Insights - Coinpedia Fintech News
summary: Cryptocurrency strategist Benjamin Cowen shared insights on Ethereum (ETH) vs Bitcoin (BTC) performance in the near future. Bitcoin's dominance is increasing, while Ethereum's performance is declining, as shown by the BTC.D and ETH/BTC charts. Cowen cautions against premature conclusions about the "flippening," as lower highs in the ETH/BTC chart have not led to a significant shift in market dynamics. Increased liquidity is making it harder for the Fed to remove excess liquidity from the market, but liquidity is gradually being reduced.

title: Bitcoin and Ethereum Dip as PEPE Falls 9% on Fading Meme Coin Mania - Yahoo Finance
summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum dropped in value on Wednesday, with Bitcoin reaching a 10-month low of $27,000. The rest of the crypto market also saw losses, with nearly all top coins and tokens experiencing sell-offs. The sharp drop in prices comes as investors shift their focus to risk-on assets like equities and tech stocks, and as the U.S. Congress races to avoid a debt-limit default. Meanwhile, meme coin mania seems to have died down, with the token Pepe falling 9% in 24 hours.

title: How to Migrate Ethereum NFTs to Bitcoin Using BRC-721E - DailyCoin
summary:
Bitcoin is gaining ground on Ethereum in the NFT market with the release of a new token standard called BRC-721E, which allows users to migrate their Ethereum NFTs to Bitcoin. This new protocol is a game-changer for the NFT industry and could signal a seismic shift in the market. BRC-721E enables assets to transition between Ethereum and Bitcoin while maintaining their unique properties and provenance.

To migrate Ethereum NFTs to Bitcoin using BRC-721E, users need to burn their ERC-721 NFTs and then inscribe the BRC-721E JSON code on Bitcoin to claim their ETH burn on Bitcoin. This process allows users to retain their NFTs' metadata and provenance while transitioning to the Bitcoin network.

However, the new standard could also hinder Bitcoin's scalability, given its recent struggles with BRC-20 memecoins and Ordinals. Despite this, Bitcoin's resurgence in the NFT sector has generated significant

title: Arbitrum (ARB) Onboards Bitcoin-Ethereum Interoperability Solution tBTC - U.Today
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Arbitrum (ARB), a leading Ethereum L2 scaler, has integrated tBTC, a non-custodial Bitcoin-Ethereum bridge solution. This integration allows for faster and more cost-efficient transactions with BTC liquidity on Arbitrum. The launch is part of the tBTC Wrapped Tour, which aims to introduce native Bitcoin liquidity to various programmable blockchains. The integration is powered by Wormhole and Balancer, and liquidity is accepted on Balancer. tBTC is the only bridge solution that avoids centralized points of failure, relying on a distributed set of validators. The launch celebrates with an NFT drop and more blockchains will be added to tBTC's range of networks supported.

title: Chainlink vs. Ethereum: Which is a Better Investment? - Deccan Herald
summary: Chainlink and Ethereum are both promising cryptocurrencies with potential for growth. Chainlink solves the problem of trust in smart contracts, making it a better investment for those looking for this solution. Ethereum, on the other hand, is a platform for decentralized application development, making it a better investment for those looking for this functionality. Ultimately, the best investment will depend on individual goals and priorities.

title: Aave Review 2024: What To Know About The Pros, Cons, Features - Milk Road
summary: Aave is a decentralized crypto lending platform that supports ERC-20 tokens such as ETH, MATIC, WBTC, and others. It allows users to supply their tokens in exchange for yield, and borrow tokens for various APY rates. Aave has its own token, AAVE, which can be staked to earn a yield and used for governance purposes. The platform offers a variety of features, including flash loans, swaps, and staking, but also comes with risks such as market price changes and liquidation penalties. The platform is open-source and has a community-driven governance model.

title: Deutsche Telekom announces support for Polygon Blockchain infrastructure - Telekom Data Intelligence Hub
summary: Deutsche Telekom, a leading telecommunications company, has announced its support for Polygon Blockchain infrastructure through its subsidiary, Deutsche Telekom MMS. The company will provide staking services to support Polygon's Supernets solutions and will become a validator on the Polygon network. This collaboration aims to expand Deutsche Telekom's activities in the field of blockchain technology and signal its support for the Polygon ecosystem. As a validator, Deutsche Telekom MMS will help secure Polygon's PoS sidechain and Supernets app-chains, contributing to their security, governance, and decentralization. This partnership will enable more businesses to embrace blockchain technology through Polygon and empower consumers by unlocking the ownership and autonomy offered by web3 technology.

title: The PulseChain Sideshow Tent Is Collapsing - CoinDesk
summary: PulseChain, a new blockchain project, has faced significant issues since its launch on May 13. Despite its initial promise of lower fees, the system has experienced high fees, buggy functionality, and a loss of millions of dollars in fees for liquidity providers. Additionally, wrapped bitcoin briefly spiked to $70,000 on the PulseX DEX, more than twice its open market price. The collapse of the PulseChain Sideshow Tent has raised questions about the project's viability.

title: From cricket to crypto: AB de Villiers ventures into Web3 - Cointelegraph
summary: Former cricket star AB de Villiers has ventured into the world of Web3 and cryptocurrency, citing the potential for financial inclusivity and leveling the playing field for retail investors. He has become an ambassador for Common Wealth, an Ethereum-based investment platform that gives everyday investors access to early-stage Web3 projects. De Villiers has also dabbled in NFTs, with a Mutant Ape being his first collectible, but he lost a portion of his collection due to a malicious NFT contract. He emphasizes the importance of simplifying the investment process and warns of the usual caveats of investing in the cryptocurrency space.

title: Polygon Blockchain jetzt mit Telekom Infrastruktur - Telekom Data Intelligence Hub
summary:
Deutsche Telekom expanding blockchain activities, becomes Polygon validator

Deutsche Telekom's subsidiary, Telekom MMS, is expanding its blockchain activities by becoming a validator for the Polygon network. Polygon is a leading Ethereum Layer 2 scaling platform, and Telekom MMS will provide infrastructure and staking services for the network. As a validator, Telekom MMS will help secure and govern the Polygon network, ensuring its safety and decentralization.

Telekom MMS is the latest company to join Polygon's validator node, following previous partnerships with Q, Flow, Celo, Chainlink, Polkadot, and Ethereum. Polygon's ecosystem is home to thousands of decentralized applications, with over 3 million transactions per day and $1.2 billion in total value locked.

The collaboration between Telekom MMS and Polygon aims to provide a secure and scalable platform for blockchain-based applications. With Polygon's Supernets, developers can create high-performance, adaptable app-chains with flexible implementation options. This allows Web3 projects

title: Pauly0x earns nearly $1M through unconventional Ethereum transfers - Cryptopolitan
summary: Crypto influencer Pauly0x made nearly $1 million by demanding Ethereum transfers to his yougetnothing.eth wallet. He tweeted about it, calling the crypto industry "an absolute joke." The wallet received over $1 million in transfers in just 7 minutes, with the majority of them being small amounts. The address also received a large transfer of 544 ETH from a crypto loan exchange. The article also discusses the recent drop in investor holdings of Ethereum, with the number of whale addresses (those with 1,000+ ETH) dropping to a 10-month low. Despite this, holdings of Ethereum continue to grow quickly.
